verses.kjv: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.
verses.ct: Jesus got into a boat, crossed over the lake, and arrived in his own town.

verses.kjv: And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.
verses.ct: Some people brought him a paralyzed man lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith, he told the paralyzed man, "Take courage, friend! Your sins are forgiven."

verses.kjv: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.
verses.ct: At this, some of the religious scholars thought to themselves, "This man is speaking against God!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?
verses.ct: Jesus, knowing what they were thinking, asked, "Why are you harboring such evil thoughts?"

verses.kjv: For whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?
verses.ct: "Which is simpler to say — 'Your sins are forgiven,' or 'Stand up and walk'?"

verses.kjv: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.
verses.ct: "But so that you'll know the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins" — then he turned to the paralyzed man — "Stand up, pick up your mat, and go home."

verses.kjv: And he arose, and departed to his house.
verses.ct: The man stood up and went home.

verses.kjv: But when the multitudes saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.
verses.ct: When the crowds witnessed this, they were amazed and praised God for giving such authority to human beings.

verses.kjv: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.
verses.ct: As Jesus was leaving that area, he noticed a man named Matthew sitting at his tax collection booth. Jesus told him, "Follow me." Matthew got up and followed him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.
verses.ct: Later, while Jesus was eating dinner at the house, many tax collectors and sinners showed up and joined him and his disciples at the table.

verses.kjv: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
verses.ct: When the Pharisees noticed this, they asked his disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?"

verses.kjv: But when Jesus heard that, he said unto them, They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.
verses.ct: Jesus overheard them and responded, "Healthy people don't need a doctor — sick people do."

verses.kjv: But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.ct: "Go and figure out what this means: 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice.' I didn't come to call righteous people, but sinners to repentance."

verses.kjv: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?
verses.ct: Then John's disciples approached him and asked, "We and the Pharisees fast regularly. Why don't your disciples fast?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "Can wedding guests be sad while the groom is still with them? But a time is coming when the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast."

verses.kjv: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.
verses.ct: "Nobody patches an old piece of clothing with unshrunk fabric, because the new patch will pull away from the old cloth and make the tear even worse."

verses.kjv: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.
verses.ct: "And nobody pours fresh wine into worn-out wineskins. If they do, the skins will burst, the wine will spill out, and the skins will be ruined. Instead, fresh wine goes into new wineskins, and both are preserved."

verses.kjv: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.
verses.ct: While he was telling them these things, a synagogue leader came and knelt before him, saying, "My daughter has just died. But if you come and place your hand on her, she will live."

verses.kjv: And Jesus arose, and followed him, and so did his disciples.
verses.ct: Jesus got up and went with him, along with his disciples.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the hem of his garment:
verses.ct: Just then, a woman who had been suffering from bleeding for 12 years came up behind him and touched the edge of his robe.

verses.kjv: For she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.
verses.ct: She had been telling herself, "If I can just touch his robe, I'll be healed."

verses.kjv: But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole from that hour.
verses.ct: Jesus turned around, and when he saw her, he said, "Take courage, daughter! Your faith has healed you." From that moment on, the woman was healed.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,
verses.ct: When Jesus arrived at the synagogue leader's house and saw the flute players and the noisy, grieving crowd,

verses.kjv: He said unto them, Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.
verses.ct: he said, "Everyone leave. The girl isn't dead — she's only sleeping." They laughed at him mockingly.

verses.kjv: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
verses.ct: But after the crowd had been sent outside, he went in, took the girl by the hand, and she got up.

verses.kjv: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.
verses.ct: News about this spread throughout the entire region.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, Thou son of David, have mercy on us.
verses.ct: As Jesus left that place, 2 blind men followed him, shouting, "Son of David, have mercy on us!"

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yea, Lord.
verses.ct: When he went inside a house, the blind men came to him. Jesus asked them, "Do you believe I'm able to do this?" They replied, "Yes, Lord."

verses.kjv: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.
verses.ct: Then he touched their eyes and said, "Let it happen for you according to your faith."

verses.kjv: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.
verses.ct: Their sight was restored, and Jesus warned them sternly, "Make sure nobody finds out about this."

verses.kjv: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
verses.ct: But after they left, they told everyone about him throughout that whole region.

verses.kjv: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
verses.ct: As those 2 were leaving, some people brought a man to Jesus who couldn't speak because he was controlled by a demon.

verses.kjv: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
verses.ct: After the demon was driven out, the man spoke. The crowds were astonished and said, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!"

verses.kjv: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.
verses.ct: But the Pharisees claimed, "He drives out demons by the power of the ruler of demons."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
verses.ct: Jesus traveled through all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom, and healing every kind of sickness and disease among the people.

verses.kjv: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
verses.ct: When he looked at the crowds, his heart broke for them, because they were worn out and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.

verses.kjv: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few;
verses.ct: Then he told his disciples, "The harvest is enormous, but the workers are few."

verses.kjv: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.
verses.ct: "So ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest field."
